Sentence.sentence: Most Americans don’t eat enough fruits, vegetables or whole grains.

Sentence.sentence: The changes would have to be approved or rejected as a whole by Congress, making it hard for narrow-interest lobbies to bend lawmakers to their will.

Sentence.sentence: Changes in policy would be approved or rejected as a whole so that lobbyists would find it hard to influence lawmakers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But now, as then, powerful forces are ideologically opposed to the whole idea of government action on a sufficient scale to jump-start the economy.

Sentence.sentence: The wireless age is expanding to include not just our phones, tablets, and laptops, but also our cars, homes,  and even whole communities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To change the light source is costly because you have to change the whole fixture.

Sentence.sentence: The whole fixture must be replaced—light source and luminaire—and this is never an inexpensive proposition.

Sentence.sentence: Should doctors consider Medicare's budget in deciding what to use?I think ethically（在道德层面上） we are just worried about the patient in front of us and not trying to save money for the insurance industry or society as a whole, said Dr.Donald Jensen.Still
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It will help to save money for society as a whole.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If a team manager exemplifies such qualities, then the team as a whole would be better able to realize their potential and achieve their objectives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: However,while talking is largely subconscious and rapid, writing is deliberate and slow, Over time,writers took advantage of this and started crafting long-winded sentences such as this one:The whole engagement lasted above 12 hours, till the gradual retreat of the Persians was changed into a disorderly flight, of which the shameful example was given by the principal leaders and……" No one talks like that casually — or should
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Trees need more water as temperatures rise, but the prolonged droughts have robbed them of moisture, making whole forests easily cleared of trees and turned into farmland.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Runaway fires pour even more carbon into the air, which increases temperatures, starting the whole vicious cycle all over again
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Until the early 1990s nobody much thought about whole populations getting older.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In that one second, it was a validation for my whole race," she recalls.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To classify parenting as a personal choice for which there is no collective responsibility is not merely to ignore the social benefits of good parenting; really, it is to steal those benefits because they accrue (不断积累) to the whole of society as today's children become tomorrow's productive citizenry (公民)
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I think that it's grossly overstated that one needs to have contact with the opposite sex right through the whole of life, in the classroom and outside the classroom and at all ages.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Oh, yes, but I wish I could have stayed awake long enough to see the whole thing.

Sentence.sentence: Oh, yeah, we had to spend the whole time inside
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The whole Antarctic region will be submerged.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都表示"完整的，全部的，整个的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: entire, whole, complete, full, total, gross, all
means: entire ： 除了有whole的意思外，还强调既不能加一个也不减少一个的含义。
whole比entire更普通，强调每个组成部分都包括在内，无一漏掉或舍去。
complete ： 强调事物在内容、程度、或数量方面已完整，已达标准。
full ： 侧重指内容，含有能包括所有的充足内容的意味。
total与complete用法相近，但强调总量。
gross ： 侧重指未打折扣，未除去成本或皮重等与净重、净数相对。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"总数，全体"之意。
means: total ： 指总量之大，强调每一构成部分或成分均被计算在内。
sum ： 指两个或更多的数目相加的总和。
whole ： 着重其中没有部分或成分被忽略不计。

means.word_mean: 齐全的, 整体的, 全部的, 完全的, 所有的

sentences.en: The whole village was attacked with influenza.
sentences.cn: 整个村子的人都得了流行性感冒。

sentences.en: The old woman has been confined to her bed for a whole year.
sentences.cn: 那老妇人已经卧病在床整整一年了。

sentences.en: Forty is a whole number.
sentences.cn: 40是个整数。

sentences.en: That's the whole truth about it.
sentences.cn: 这就是事情的全部真相。

sentences.en: He ate an apple whole.
sentences.cn: 他把整个苹果一口吃下。

means.word_mean: 没有破碎的; 完整的; 完好无损的

sentences.en: You're lucky to escape with a whole skin.
sentences.cn: 你未受损伤而逃脱, 真是幸运。

sentences.en: Did you break the whole dish?
sentences.cn: 盘子被你打碎了?

sentences.en: He was surprised to find himself whole after the accident.
sentences.cn: 他惊奇地发现自己在事故发生后安然无恙。

means.word_mean: （强调大小或重要性）整个的，全部的
齐全, 整体, 全部

sentences.en: The whole of my money was stolen.
sentences.cn: 我全部的钱都被偷走了。

sentences.en: He spent the whole of the week in hospital.
sentences.cn: 他住院住了整整一星期。

sentences.en: Two halves make a whole.
sentences.cn: 两个一半构成一个整体。</seg>

（强调大小或重要性）整个的，全部的
as a whole 作为一个整体；总体上
on the whole 总的说来；大体上；基本上
a whole lot 非常；很多

sentence.en: She was the envy of the whole community.

sentence.en: The whole team count on cristiano ronaldo,  and he seldom lets them down.

mean.mean: （强调大小或重要性）整个的，全部的

lj.lj_ls: 许多石头建的教堂全部或部分留存下来。

lj.lj_ly: he was the nicest person in the whole world.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)everything possible or available
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)任何可能的事；任何可得到的东西

lj.lj_ly: send in the troops, aircraft, nuclear submarine experts, the whole nine yards.
lj.lj_ls: 派军队、飞机、核潜艇专家等一切能派上用场的人或物。

jx.jx_en_mean: All parts or aspects considered; altogether
jx.jx_cn_mean: 所有部分和方面都考虑到；整个看来

lj.lj_ly: disliked the acting but enjoyed the play as a whole.
lj.lj_ls: 不喜欢表演但整体上喜欢这个剧

lj.lj_ly: on the whole, a happy marriage.
lj.lj_ls: 总的看来，是个幸福的结合

jx.jx_en_mean: In most instances or cases; as a rule
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在大多数情况下；大体上，基本上

lj.lj_ly: can expect sunny weather, on the whole.
lj.lj_ls: 大体上会有睛朗的天气

entry.def: If you refer to the whole of something, you mean all of it.

example.ex: He has said he will make an apology to the whole of Asia for his country's past behaviour...
example.tran: 他已表示要为自己国家过去的行径向全亚洲道歉。

example.ex: I was cold throughout the whole of my body.

entry.def: A whole is a single thing which contains several different parts.

example.ex: An atom itself is a complete whole, with its electrons, protons and neutrons and other elements...
example.tran: 一个原子本身就是一个完整的整体，包括电子、质子、中子及其他元素。

example.ex: Taken as a percentage of the whole, the mouth has to be a fairly minor body part.
example.tran: 和全身比起来，嘴可算是身体中较小的一部分。

entry.def: If something is whole, it is in one piece and is not broken or damaged.

example.ex: Much of the temple was ruined, but the front was whole, as well as a large hall behind it...
example.tran: 庙宇的大部分都被毁坏了，但其正面及后面的大厅还保存完好。

example.ex: I struck the glass with my fist with all my might; yet it remained whole...
example.tran: 我用拳头拼命砸向玻璃，可它还是完好无损。

entry.def: You use whole to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It was like seeing a whole different side of somebody...
example.tran: 这就像是看到一个人完全不同的一面。

example.ex: His father had helped invent a whole new way of doing business.
example.tran: 他父亲帮助创造了一套全新的生意经。

entry.def: If you refer to something as a whole, you are referring to it generally and as a single unit.

example.ex: He described the move as a victory for the people of South Africa as a whole...
example.tran: 他把这一举动描述成整个南非人民的胜利。

example.ex: As a whole we do not eat enough fibre in Britain.
example.tran: 总体上我们英国人没有摄入足够的膳食纤维。

entry.def: You use on the whole to indicate that what you are saying is true in general but may not be true in every case, or that you are giving a general opinion or summary of something.

example.ex: On the whole, people miss the opportunity to enjoy leisure...
example.tran: 总的来说，人们渴望享受闲暇的时光。

example.ex: The wine towns encountered are, on the whole, quiet and modest.
example.tran: 所到的酒镇总的来说都是宁静祥和的。

means.word_mean: 1. all of something including all its component elements or parts;
2. an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity;

sentences.sentence: "how big is that part compared to the whole?"

means.word_mean: 1. including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete;

sentences.sentence: "the baby cried the whole trip home"

means.word_mean: 3. exhibiting or restored to vigorous good health;
1. to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly');

sentences.sentence: "it was completely different from what we expected"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hāl, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch heel and German heil, also to hail. The spelling with wh- (reflecting a dialect pronunciation with w-) first appeared in the 15th cent
